16: Finally made cauldron recipe calculator working on the most of relatively recent Excel versions (tested down to 2016, but I think it should work on 2013 as well, and maybe even on 2010).[BR]First of all you need solver add-in enabled (how to enable it).[BR]Then download https://tinyurl.com/ElvenarCauldron[BR]Open it, allow editing and unblock active content (VBA macros). VBA is used there for the only purpose of emulating =SORT() function which exists only in Excel 2021 and later.[BR]Ingredients are sorted same way as they are in game, amounts are here (both starting point for solver and resulting recipe, you can clear them all to start from scratch):[BR]Spoiler: screenshot[IMG]https://i.ibb.co/p2RDnq3/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674516858188-png-10848.png[/IMG]this recipe looks like this in game:[BR][IMG]https://i.ibb.co/phH5Kbp/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674516949251-png-10849.png[/IMG][BR]There is a small rounding error in calculating required witch points, but I guess +-3 is not a big issue.The usage is simple (mentioned cells are marked with red squares like on first screenshot):[BR]1. write down your current available witch points and research diplomas amount in appropriate cells:[BR]Spoiler: screenshot[IMG]https://i.ibb.co/0hZk3kq/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674517195006-png-10850.png[/IMG][BR]Notice effects that you can get with written amount of diplomas are marked cyan.2. Select diamonds-blocked ingredients by entering 1 in appropriate cells:[BR]Spoiler: screenshot[IMG]https://i.ibb.co/9THWVVy/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674517217171-png-10851.png[/IMG]3. write down weights of your desired effects (on screenshot and in the file these are only military effects, with mc_strength having a bit bigger priority and tg_strength - a bit lower.[BR]Spoiler: screenshot[IMG]https://i.ibb.co/nj4Wdww/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674517518381-png-10852.png[/IMG]4. start solver add-in (On the Data tab, in the Analysis group, click Solver.) and press Solve.[BR]Solver would try to maximize the SUM of your weighted effect probabilities (you can see it at the left of the weights).[BR]It may take some time, but you can control the process by pressing Esc from time to time and looking how it's going. If it is not changing for a long time you can stop it or wait for timeout.[BR]5. The result is the list of ingredients, amount of required witch points and effect probabilities. Note that you should invest ingredients starting from max used one going down to least used one, or your actual WP cost will be bigger than in recipe.[BR]Spoiler: screenshot[IMG]https://i.ibb.co/3MZBPft/https-beta-forum-elvenar-com-index-php-attachments-1674518520996-png-10854.png[/IMG][BR]Individual probabilities are marked light green near their weights, their sum = the chance of getting at least one useful effect on each try, there is also overall success rate listed (77.46%).[BR]With this recipe I would have 29.6% chance to get barracks strength effect and same for MC strength (59.2% total). + will have 23.54% chance to get back used spell fragments if I use some.If you found some issues - feel free to report it.
